oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn. Harry T. Burn, 1919
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Harry T. Burn (1895-1977). From Niota, TN. He represented McMinn County in the Tennessee House of Representatives. His "yes' vote, encouraged by a letter from his mother, broke a tie and caused Tennessee to ratify the Nineteenth Amendment. Tennessee was the 36th state to ratify the 19th Amendment and it then became law.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Harry T. Burn, portraits, politicians
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
